snippet: Jobs lost by women during the recession have since been recovered, though women’s share of the jobs in most industries has fallen.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off The Charts column analyzes report from Bureau of Labor Statistics finding that all jobs lost by women during Great Recession have been recovered, while men still have long way to go; suggests some professions with predominately female work force have done better than economy as whole.
lead_paragraph: Jobs lost by women during the recession have since been recovered, though women’s share of the jobs in most industries has fallen.

headline.print_headline: Gender Gaps Appear as Employment Recovers From the Recession
headline.main: Gender Gaps Appear as Employment Recovers From the Recession
